body: AFAIK this already exists in Mlflow but there exists a bug to this functionality. See https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/issues/2804 for more information.
@Rusteam thank you for filing this, and, @tahesse, thank you for responding. We have merged https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/pull/5187 to address this issue. Thank you for using MLflow!

@dbczumar that PR seems to address MLflow Projects.
Would it also allow to set a run name from `MLflowClient().create_run()` for other use cases?
@Rusteam My apologies. I misinterpreted. We're excited to review a PR for this, if you're still willing to contribute one.

Definitely. I can do this.

In a nutshell, what I have to do is to:
- add `run_name` parameter to `create_run()` in **sqlalchemy_store.py**
- add `run_name` parameter to `RunInfo()` in **run_info.py** in the call inside `create_run()` in `file_store.py`
- to set a `run_name` from `create_run()` in `tracking.MLflowClient()`, default is None or "".

anything else?

@dbczumar, 

stuck at this error:
```
    return _message.default_pool.FindFieldByName(full_name)
E   KeyError: "Couldn't find field mlflow.CreateRun.run_name"
```

added:
```
    _descriptor.FieldDescriptor(
      name='tags', full_name='mlflow.CreateExperiment.tags', index=2,
      number=3, type=11, cpp_type=10, label=3,
      has_default_value=False, default_value=[],
      message_type=None, enum_type=None, containing_type=None,
      is_extension=False, extension_scope=None,
      serialized_options=None, file=DESCRIPTOR),
``` 
 to **service_pb2.py**

and ` optional string run_name = 11;` to `CreateRun` in **service.proto**,
but without any luck.

If you can give me some directions how to fix this issue, would save me tons of time. Thanks

> @dbczumar,
> 
> stuck at this error:
> 
> ```
>     return _message.default_pool.FindFieldByName(full_name)
> E   KeyError: "Couldn't find field mlflow.CreateRun.run_name"
> ```
> 
> added:
> 
> ```
>     _descriptor.FieldDescriptor(
>       name='tags', full_name='mlflow.CreateExperiment.tags', index=2,
>       number=3, type=11, cpp_type=10, label=3,
>       has_default_value=False, default_value=[],
>       message_type=None, enum_type=None, containing_type=None,
>       is_extension=False, extension_scope=None,
>       serialized_options=None, file=DESCRIPTOR),
> ```
> 
> to **service_pb2.py**
> 
> and ` optional string run_name = 11;` to `CreateRun` in **service.proto**, but without any luck.
> 
> If you can give me some directions how to fix this issue, would save me tons of time. Thanks

Hi @Rusteam , apologies for the delay here. Instead of extending the REST API, can we add a `name=None` argument to `create_run()` and, if it's not `None`, add the corresponding run name tag to the dictionary of tags that are passed as part of the CreateRun request?

That's what I was gonna do. 
In that case it wouldn't be handled by FileStore and SQLAlchemyStore, would it?

> That's what I was gonna do. In that case it wouldn't be handled by FileStore and SQLAlchemyStore, would it?

Hi @Rusteam , apologies for the delay. `MlflowClient.create_run()` now accepts the `run_name` argument: https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/37f4bbe69e975a505a0b61bc7509bad3f784efdf/mlflow/tracking/client.py#L224. Thank you for using MLflow!
